heading: M&S to launch clothing repairs service
description: The move comes as retailers try to encourage more sustainable habits among their shoppers.

heading: Charity event brings community 'closer to nature'
description: People came together to enjoy sustainable food talks, art workshops and forest school sessions.

heading: Britain's myth-shrouded, sacred wetlands
description: Legends will always swirl around Glastonbury, but conservation projects like the Avalon Marshes point to a future that transcends the mythical and has real benefits for our planet.

heading: Protecting Portugal's largest reef
description: On one of Portugal's most well-trodden coastlines, communities are working to preserve marine life and ensure vital food sources – such as octopus – are available long into the future.

heading: Is it ethical to travel to the ends of the Earth?
description: Despite the risks, costs and environmental concerns of extreme tourism, people are still drawn to potentially dangerous trips – but why?

heading: Why Japan has an excess sushi problem
description: The country's ubiquitous convenience stores throw out huge amounts of edible food. In Tokyo, Rachel Nuwer meets the campaigners trying to change that.

heading: The Scottish isle you can only visit on a day trip
description: Every spring, almost 100,000 seabirds – guillemots, great skuas, razorbills and puffins – descend on the small island of Handa, just off Scotland's far north-west coast.

heading: Measuring air pollution in Paris ahead of the Olympics
description: Former Paralympian Steve Brown visits Paris ahead of the 2024 Summer Olympics and Paralympics.
